text: Tepi () is a village in the historical region of Khevi, north-eastern Georgia. It is located on the left bank of the Tergi river. Administratively, it is part of the Kazbegi Municipality in Mtskheta-Mtianeti. Distance to the municipality center Stepantsminda is 44.5 km. == Sources == * Georgian Soviet Encyclopedia, V. 9, p. 702, Tbilisi, 1985 year. ==References== Category:Kobi Community villages
title: Tepi (village)
